pullRequest.body:
This PR proves that normed groups with a norm satisfying `IsUltrametricDist` are nonarchimedean topological groups, and also that continuous maps from a compact space to an ultrametric space are an ultrametric space.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]

-->

- [x] depends on: #14768
[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

nodes.body:
### PR summary [9eb495515c](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/17262/commits/9eb495515c2b222f5c9f3ecc8e18fc1d28ca3922)

Import changes exceeding 2%

| %      | File |
| -      | -    |
| +17.63% | `Mathlib.Analysis.Normed.Group.Ultra` |

<details><summary>

#### Import changes for modified files

</summary>

Dependency changes

| File | Base Count | Head Count | Change |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| Mathlib.Analysis.Normed.Group.Ultra | 930 | 1094 | +164 (+17.63%) |


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.Analysis.Normed.Ring.Ultra`|62|
| `Mathlib.Analysis.Normed.Group.Ultra`|164|
| `Mathlib.Topology.MetricSpace.Ultra.ContinuousMaps`|1330|

</details>

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ ContinuousMap.isUltrametricDist`
`+ ball_openSubgroup`
`+ closedBall_openSubgroup`
`+ nonarchimedeanGroup`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

I think your PR description has a typo, and should be
> ultrametric normed groups are nonarchimedean

> Do you think it's worthwhile to combine these with my lemmas in #14768 https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/14768/files#diff-59aef0da4a062256a000d746f59803a758717edfd3fd33f52b9ed92edafe5d03R169-R182 I know I proved them there for `SeminormedAddGroup` but should be easy to switch them to `SeminormedGroup` and additivize

Ah, I guessed you were the right person to ask, but I hadn't seen you had already PR'ed literally the same things!

Given that your PR is much wider in scope, I think the best option is for me to set this one to "blocked-by-other-PR" for the time being, and I'll do what I can to help you get #14768 reviewed; once that's done, we can revisit this one and slim it down to a small PR for any leftover lemmas that weren't subsumed in #14768.

I see you have already switched over to using `@to_additive` in #14768, which is great.

This PR/issue depends on:
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#14768~~
By **[Dependent Issues](https://github.com/z0al/dependent-issues)** (🤖). Happy coding!
<!-- By Dependent Issues (Action) - DO NOT REMOVE -->

:v: loefflerd can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).
bors r+

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11178938304/job/31077527124)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11178938304/job/31077527702)
bors d+
bors d+

Do you think it's worthwhile to combine these with my lemmas in #14768 
https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/14768/files#diff-59aef0da4a062256a000d746f59803a758717edfd3fd33f52b9ed92edafe5d03R169-R182
I know I proved them there for `SeminormedAddGroup` but should be easy to switch them to `SeminormedGroup` and additivize
I've multiplicativized #14768 so that this and related lemmas are there

```suggestion
    {r : ℝ} (hr : 0 < r) : OpenSubgroup G where
  carrier := Metric.closedBall (1 : G) r
  mul_mem' {x} {y} hx hy := by
    simp only [Metric.mem_closedBall, dist_one_right] at hx hy ⊢
    exact (norm_mul_le_max x y).trans (max_le hx hy)
  one_mem' := Metric.mem_closedBall_self hr.le
  inv_mem' := by simp
  isOpen' := IsUltrametricDist.isOpen_closedBall _ hr.ne'
```

just a thought. the proofs are just a tiny bit simpler. of course, it's morally the same.

```suggestion
def ballOpenSubgroup (G : Type*) [SeminormedGroup G] [IsUltrametricDist G]
```

FWIW: I haven't applied this change yet, because Yakov pointed out that one can do the same for closed balls too (closed balls are open!), and I wasn't sure what case convention to use for the closed-ball version. So for now it is "ball_openSubgroup" and "closedBall_openSubgroup", and I'm inviting @eric-wieser or anyone else to tell me what the standard convention would be.
Can you add the `nnnorm` version too?
I've multiplicativized #14768 so that this and related lemmas are there

```suggestion
    [IsUltrametricDist G] : NonarchimedeanGroup G where
  is_nonarchimedean  := by
```
Can you use the unprimed `induction` here instead?

```suggestion
In a group with an ultrametric norm, open balls around 1 of positive radius are open subgroups.
```

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat (Analysis/Normed/Group): ultrametric normed groups are nonarchimedean
